Praise the Sun! This worked.

As one problem gets solved, another one rises. Now it's a problem with Science! I can't take crew reports, goo readings, surface sample, anything related to science(I edited persistent.sfs to test if I needed to build science to get science).

Edited May 1, 2014 by Briefmoment
Could you please post output_log.txt from KSP_Data in your main KSP install. Compress it in a zip first so it's just a few kB.

I found out what was prohibiting RO from working correctly, it was just install order. I completely re installed KSP and did a clean install with all the required mods first, started and exited the game, then did the game for RO, than NathanKell's RealEngines. It feels good to be clean, but with a cost; after finding that out, I died a little on the inside. xD

ok so ive been with KSP since the beginning so i like to think iam pretty apt in installing and running the mutitude of mods that are around. Having said that i lost heart about 2 patches ago when i kept losing my saved games, the furthest ive got with any tech tree is to land on the mun.

and now to this mod etc well after a week of installing and uninstalling reading and printing idiot guides i have finally got this mod and all of the extras to run and actually got mod manager to run which ive never seen before.

ok so this is very cool mod and tech tree , however to get it to run i had to delete certain files mainly Rcs block ,Probes Aies , liner R ,RCS and RSC thruster. no i dea why these wont work and just totally blocks the install maybe some clever chap or maid can figure it out but other than that it runs fine even if i am a bit stuck on the science.

For those playing with RemoteTech, and RSS' latest inclusion of extra launch sites, I've done a RT2 Settings config to place ground stations at all of said launch sites.

LINK

Fair warning: You might want to turn off RT2 displaying ALL antenna connections on the in-flight map view, and instead show only your ship's connection line. Otherwise it will be... cluttered.

griffin247: if you're having an issue with RPL (you mention "WAC experiments"), probably best to ask on the RPL thread.
also how do i adjust the height of the clouds in settings so i can see them ? and how do i delete things i dont want in the tech tree to save ram ?

griffin247: if you're having an issue with RPL (you mention "WAC experiments"), probably best to ask on the RPL thread.

erhm no iam playing real solar system and realisum etc

Yes, I get that you're playing RO. However, the only mod that includes the WAC Corporal probe core, and that has experiments for it, is RPL, the tech tree mod. I didn't make that mod. If you have questions about it, please ask there.

To edit cloud height, press ALT+N while in flight, then increase the altitude to something like 10000.

To delete parts you don't want, open GameData, browse to the mod it's from, find the folder for the part you want to delete, and delete that folder.

ok i am confused i thought i was playing the tech tree that went with all the realism mods and real solar system. anyway thanks for the info and fantastic mod etc really invigarated my enthusisum for KSP again.

You are. That tech tree is called Realistic Progression Lite, is made by MedievalNerd, and has its own thread.

Cool! You're most welcome.
